column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Meza-Cuadra (Peru) (spoke in Spanish): We\r
#Text=appreciate the initiative of the Plurinational State of\r
#Text=Bolivia in convening this timely open debate.
#Text=Peru\r
#Text=is committed to the women and peace and security\r
#Text=agenda.
#Text=Together with Sweden, we have the honour\r
#Text=of chairing the group of experts that promotes that\r
#Text=agenda in the Council.
#Text=As such, we fully support\r
#Text=the statements of Minister Wallstrom of Sweden and\r
#Text=Minister Brandt of the Netherlands, who today honour\r
#Text=us with their presence.
#Text=We would also like to commend\r
#Text=the important briefings of the Secretary-General, the\r
#Text=Executive Director of UN-Women and, on behalf of\r
#Text=women's organizations, Ms.
#Text=Randa Siniora Atallah.
#Text=Peru emphasizes the importance of women's\r
#Text=participation and leadership in the maintenance of\r
#Text=international peace and security and, in relation to\r
#Text=that, the primary responsibility of national States in\r
#Text=promoting their political and economic empowerment.
#Text=Since 2000, the Council has adopted eight resolutions\r
#Text=that have served to set an agenda and develop good\r
#Text=practices in that area.
#Text=Nevertheless, barriers and\r
#Text=challenges persist, forcing us to redouble our efforts\r
#Text=as we approach the commemoration in 2020 of the\r
#Text=twentieth anniversary of the historic resolution 1325\r
#Text=The evidence shows that when women participate\r
#Text=more at every level of political life, societies are less\r
#Text=inclined to conflict and more inclined to maintain\r
#Text=and consolidate peace.
#Text=Women bring perspectives\r
#Text=on future and unity that are essential to building and\r
#Text=sustaining peace.
#Text=In that regard, we emphasize that\r
#Text=gender equality and women's economic and political\r
#Text=empowerment contribute to reducing their particular\r
#Text=vulnerabilities during conflict and in general to\r
#Text=preventing violence and advancing human resilience,\r
#Text=as well as achieving the Sustainable Development\r
#Text=Goals.
#Text=An investment in women's empowerment is\r
#Text=an investment in peace and development as well as in\r
#Text=protecting and promoting their human rights.
#Text=That is\r
#Text=why we want to highlight and support the Secretary-\r
#Text=General's vision and the priority he gives to developing\r
#Text=and implementing this agenda, based on the concept of\r
#Text=sustainable peace.
#Text=With regard to the role of women in\r
#Text=the maintenance of international peace and security, we\r
#Text=underscore the Secretary-General's views on the need\r
#Text=to promote their participation and leadership in every\r
#Text=peace effort, starting with active collaboration with\r
#Text=women's civil-society organizations.
#Text=In that regard,\r
#Text=we wan to emphasize the importance of contributing\r
#Text=to financing the women's organizations that have been\r
#Text=asked to participate in the peace processes launched by\r
#Text=the Council.
#Text=We also underscore the importance of incorporating\r
#Text=gender perspectives into peace operations mandated\r
#Text=by the Council.
#Text=In our View it is crucial to train Blue\r
#Text=Helmets in promoting and protecting women's and\r
#Text=children's human rights.
#Text=In that regard, and in view\r
#Text=of the provisions of resolution 1820 (2008), Peru has\r
#Text=been gradually increasing women's participation in the\r
#Text=armed forces we send to United Nations peacekeeping\r
#Text=operations, and we have already surpassed the minimum\r
#Text=15 per cent required in the resolution.
#Text=Still with regard to the agenda on women and peace\r
#Text=and security, our Ministry of Women and Vulnerable\r
#Text=Populations has created a displaced persons registry\r
#Text=that enables us to quickly recognize and address issues\r
#Text=relating to the rights of women and girls who were\r
#Text=affected during the years in which Peru was battling\r
#Text=terrorism.
#Text=Our Government has also committed to\r
#Text=implementing policies aimed at empowering women\r
#Text=in the political and economic life of the country,\r
#Text=with a decentralized approach that includes the need\r
#Text=to guarantee the election of women to positions\r
#Text=of authority.
#Text=I would like to conclude by citing in this debate\r
#Text=the voice of Flora Tristan, a Peruvian citizen who was\r
#Text=one of the great nineteenth-century pioneers in the\r
#Text=vindication of the rights of women:\r
#Text=\r
#Text="All of the world's misfortunes stem from the\r
#Text=oblivion and contempt in which the natural and\r
#Text=essential rights of being a woman have been held\r
#Text=until now".
